docs.lead_paragraph: Estonia, Latvia, Lithuania, Poland and Union of Soviet Socialist Republics. Parcel post for Denmark, Finland, Poland and Sweden. South America, West Indies, Etc. COTTICA (Royal Netherlands), Inagua Sept. 6, Port au Prince Sept. 7, Curacao Sept. 10, Porto Cabello Sept. 11, La Guayra Sept. 12, Guanta Sept. 13, Porto Sucre Sept. 13, Pampatar Sept. 14, Carupano Sept. 14.

docs.snippet: United States exports and imports declined in July from the same month a year ago, but exports for the first seven months of this year were slightly ahead of the total from January to July of 1937, the Deapartment of Commerce reported today.
docs.lead_paragraph: United States exports and imports declined in July from the same month a year ago, but exports for the first seven months of this year were slightly ahead of the total from January to July of 1937, the Deapartment of Commerce reported today.

docs.snippet: The passenger and freight ship Uruguay, first of three ships of the new American Republics Line service to be renovated for operation to South America, sailed yesterday from Newport News for New York to be taken over by decorators.
docs.lead_paragraph: The passenger and freight ship Uruguay, first of three ships of the new American Republics Line service to be renovated for operation to South America, sailed yesterday from Newport News for New York to be taken over by decorators.

docs.snippet: The Mexican Government is using strong diplomatic pressure in an effort to persuade South American republics to enter into' barter arrangements by which they take petroleum from confiscated United States and British oil fields and ship their own...
docs.lead_paragraph: The Mexican Government is using strong diplomatic pressure in an effort to persuade South American republics to enter into' barter arrangements by which they take petroleum from confiscated United States and British oil fields and ship their own products to Mexico in payment.

headline.main: URUGUAY WILL BUY HER OIL IN MEXICO; Barter Plan Is Arranged for Country's Entire Supply of Crude Product for 1939 BIG PRICE CUTS ARE MADE Deals Offered Argentina and Brazil to Exchange Oil for Their Commodities Bilateral Agreements Offered U. S. Companies are Underbid

byline.original: By JOHN W. WHITESpecial Cable to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: In July and again in August the United States Secretary of State, Cordell Hull, addressed notes of mounting sharpness to the government of Mexico. He referred to the expropriation of American-owned farms below the Rio Grande for distribution among...
docs.lead_paragraph: In July and again in August the United States Secretary of State, Cordell Hull, addressed notes of mounting sharpness to the government of Mexico. He referred to the expropriation of American-owned farms below the Rio Grande for distribution among landless peons, and to the fact that the owners had not been paid except in promises.
